018package org.opengis.filter;
019
020import java.util.List;
021import java.util.Optional;
022import org.opengis.annotation.UML;
023
024import static org.opengis.annotation.Obligation.OPTIONAL;
025import static org.opengis.annotation.Obligation.MANDATORY;
026import static org.opengis.annotation.Specification.ISO_19143;
027
028
029/**
030 * An operator that evaluates if the value of an expression is nil.
031 * The difference with {@link NullOperator} is that a value should exist
032 * but cannot be provided for the reason given by {@link #getNilReason()}.
033 * A nil value is not necessarily {@code null}; implementations are free to use placeholders.
034 *
035 * @author  Johann Sorel (Geomatys)
036 * @author  Martin Desruisseaux (Geomatys)
037 * @version 3.1
038 * @since   3.1
039 *
040 * @param  <R>  the type of resources (e.g. {@link org.opengis.feature.Feature}) to filter.
041 */
042@UML(identifier="NilOperator", specification=ISO_19143)
043public interface NilOperator<R> extends ComparisonOperator<R> {
044    /**
045     * Returns the nature of the comparison.
046     * The default implementation returns {@code PROPERTY_IS_NIL}.
047     *
048     * @return the nature of the comparison.
049     */
050    @Override
051    default ComparisonOperatorName getOperatorType() {
052        return ComparisonOperatorName.PROPERTY_IS_NIL;
053    }
054
055    /**
056     * Returns the expression whose value will be checked for nil.
057     *
058     * @return a list of size 1 containing the expression to test for nil value.
059     */
060    @Override
061    @UML(identifier="expression", obligation=MANDATORY, specification=ISO_19143)
062    List<Expression<R,?>> getExpressions();
063
064    /**
065     * Returns the reason why the value is nil.
066     * Possible reasons are:
067     *
068     * <ul>
069     *   <li><b>inapplicable</b> — there is no value.</li>
070     *   <li><b>template</b>     — the value will be available later.</li>
071     *   <li><b>missing</b>      — the correct value is not readily available to the sender of this data.
072     *                             Furthermore, a correct value may not exist.</li>
073     *   <li><b>unknown</b>      — the correct value is not known to, and not computable by, the sender of this data.
074     *                             However, a correct value probably exists..</li>
075     *   <li><b>withheld</b>     — the value is not divulged.</li>
076     *   <li>Other strings at implementation choice.</li>
077     * </ul>
078     *
079     * @return the reason why the value is nil, or empty for any reason.
080     */
081    @UML(identifier="nilReason", obligation=OPTIONAL, specification=ISO_19143)
082    default Optional<String> getNilReason() {
083        return Optional.empty();
084    }
085}
